author: Daniel Wiessner
title: EEOC Monitor: FedEx must produce 360K emails in deaf bias case
text:
A federal judge has ordered FedEx Ground Package System Inc to deliver more than 360,000 internal emails to the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission in a case accusing the company of refusing to hire deaf job applicants.
U.S. District Judge Mark Hornak in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania on March 21 rejected FedExâ€™s claim that the vast pool of emails would likely yield only a small number of relevant documents, so it was not worth the time and expense of sifting through them.
